The terms lakh (100,000 – that is to say 1,00,000 in the Indian system) and crore (10,000,000 – that is to say 1,00,00,000 in the Indian system) are used in Indian English to express large numbers. 1 In Telugu, a lakh is called లక్ష laksha and a crore is called కోటి koti. 2  In Urdu, a lakh is called لاکھ lākh and a crore is called کروڑ karoṛ. 3  Lakh has entered the Swahili language as  laki  and is in common use.

The Indian numbering system is used in India as well as in Bangladesh, Nepal, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka.
